David,

Why not output the .toString() of the parameters?

This is how Test=
NG does it:

  @DataProvider(name =3D "A")
  protected Object[][] dp(ITestC=
ontext tc) {
    return new Object[][] {
        { "Cedric", 20 },
        =
{ "David", 21 },
    };
  }

  @Test(dataProvider =3D "A")
  public void te=
stA(String s, int n) {
  }

Output:

PASSED: testA("Cedric", 20)
PASSED: te=
stA("David", 21)

=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=
=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=
=3D=3D=3D
    Priority
    Tests run: 2, Failures: 0, Skips: 0
=3D=3D=3D=3D=
=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=
=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D

This makes it trivi=
al to diagnose a failed data-driven test.
